Will cs8 be available to enroll for phase 1? (April 30)
I checked my enrollment setup notes. It looks like Garcia does intend to webcast CS 61C in F19.
CS61B is historically always been webcast, given that it is such a large class.
Is there any info on CS61B (I dont plan on taking CS61C)? Thank you!

inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs61b/fa18

sp19.datastructur.es
When will we know whether or not CS61B will be webcast? I won't be able to attend lectures at all and I'm worried enrolling if theres a chance that they wont be webcast.
You might check for updates in this post or just try checking if you can enroll periodically..
where can i check if cs61C and c8 are able to enroll

CS 61C remains closed so you cannot enroll even if you want to. I changed the status to CLOSED in an effort to reduce the number of requests for permission to enroll. (Department Consent made it look like you could get in when you could not.)

At this point, we're still waiting on the Registrar to let us know about classrooms before we can settle the day/time and location issues for this class.
Thanks for reply.
I’m confused . Should we now enroll for 61c  or just wait ? I was checking the class today and its on waitlist status.

At this point I wouldn't count on any of them being available until the end of May at the earliest. Some of them won't be available at all but I don't have a definitive list yet of which fit into that category. When I know more, I'll post.
Is there an estimated date to when the self paced courses (CS 9*) will be back online for us to sign up for?

We restrict enrollment to 70% of the budgeted total enrollment until we know what will happen with GSI/TA hiring. Once we know there are enough teaching support, we expand enrollment which then pulls people off wait list into the class. (During phases 1 & 2, the reserve requirements apply which mean that wait listed EECS/LSCS majors will move into class ahead of non-majors on the wait list.)
Hi, maybe it's a dumb question but what exactly is the 70% rule?
same
Try enrolling again - it's hard to open 3 classes simultaneously within 60 seconds. I was a minute or two late in opening CS 61C. Should be open now.
Thank you!
Why does it say "Department Consent Required" for CS 61C? Does this mean I cannot enroll?
The time and location shown in classes.berkeley.edu are correct. MWF 11am-noon in Wheeler 150

"CS C8 (Data 8) – remains temporarily closed until lab sections can be rescheduled now that the lecture time has been set. We anticipate that class will open for enrollment by 5/3. Watch for separate announcement when that class opens."

Can you please specify at what time will the lecture take place? so I make sure I don't enroll in anything at that hour.
Until recently we hadn't heard. Since the class is expanding past the room capacity YES it will be webcast.
Is it the case that CS70 will be webcast for fa19? The note explicitly mentions that 61ABC will be, but makes no mention of whether or not 70 will be webcast.
Same question
Anon, what's your position?
Unlikely, since class isn't webcast.
My position is 120....apologies if I missed it somewhere, but is it new policy that CS70 is not going to be webcasted this upcoming semester?

@10071

Just expanded.
Will CS70 expand as it has in the past? I noticed that the capacity is at 744 seats but in the past it has accommodated up to 900 students. Thanks!
Don't worry about purging the wait list - that's something that we haven't done since Fall 2017.

We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

Could this be clarified? Say for an incoming freshman, if I don't have 61A yet and plan to enroll in it during adjustment, would that be okay or not? If not should I make sure to be enrolled in it now? Thanks.

It just re-opened last night so you can wait list now BUT remember, just because you're on the wait list doesn't mean you're guaranteed to get into the class. You should be prepared with a back up plan just in case. Even though we have managed to accommodate everyone in past semesters, we are hitting resource constraints this year that are making it challenging to continue this tradition.
Is 61c enrollment closed for the semester?

history.content:
F19 Enrollment: Lower Div COMPSCI Classes

(updated 8/25/19)

 

This is the master list of announcements for F19 lower div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

New for F19: The enrollment system will now enforce credit restrictions at enrollment. Credit restrictions occur when the content of one course overlaps with another offered at UCB to such a degree that students should not receive credit for taking both courses.


Currently there is no warning for students if a class they are enroll into has a credit restriction with a class they have already completed. Beginning in F19 enrollment, a warning message will appear to warn of the restriction.

 

  •        (updated) CS C8 (Data 8) – The wait list for this class has been cut in half and restricted so that no more students can wait list. This class will NOT expand again and we do not expect all currently wait listed students to get into the class from attrition.

  • This class will NOT use 999 sections. This means you need to enroll in the lecture as well as specific discussion and lab sections.  

               If you are wait listed and wish to change sections of the class, you will need to DROP the class and re-enroll. If you are accidentally dropped to the end of the waitlist when this happens, we will NOT be able to restore you to your previous wait list position.

               This class WILL be webcast and time conflicts ARE allowed with this class.

  •        CS 9 series – These classes are in the process of being revamped and will not be offered during F19.

  •        CS 10 – This class will NOT use 999 sections in F19. This means you need to enroll in the lecture as well as specific discussion and lab sections. 

    If you are waitlisted and wish to change sections of the class, you will need to DROP the class and re-enroll. If you are accidentally dropped to the end of the waitlist when this happens, we will NOT be able to restore you to your previous wait list position.

  •        CS 61A – (updated 8/20) Class enrollment has expanded to 2,000.       Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections. (read below in this post to learn about 999 sections)

                 Class will be webcast.

                 Visit classes.berkeley.edu to see the actual section times if you need them for planning purposes. 

  •        CS 61B - Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections. Class will be webcast.

  •        (updated) CS 61C –  Class has been expanded to max capacity & WL is now closed. Currently wait listed students will only be enrolled via attrition as already-enrolled students drop.
                      Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections. (read below in this post to learn about 999 sections). Class will be webcast.

  •        CS 70 – (updated 8/20)  Class enrollment has expanded to 900 students! Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections. Class will be webcast.

              NO TIME CONFLICTS ALLOWED!
              

  •        CS 88 – Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1.      To see who can enroll into CS lower div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower


  2.      Time Conflicts – Unless noted, the enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3.      Waitlist Processing:
  •        We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.
  •        During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.
  •        If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.
  •        Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1.      999 sections will be used for lower division classes for EXCEPT CS C8 and CS 10. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

        Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  •        During first lecture
  •        Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)
  •        Via course home page

  •        CS 61C

 

CS C8 remains temporarily closed until lab sections can be rescheduled now that the lecture time has been set. CS 88 remains closed until we have an instructor for the class. We anticipate that these classes will open for enrollment by 5/3. Watch for separate announcement when that class opens.

New for F19: The enrollment system will now enforce credit restrictions at enrollment. Credit restrictions occur when the content of one course overlaps with another offered at UCB to such a degree that students should not receive credit for taking both courses.

  •        Via course home page

    NO TIME CONFLICTS ALLOWED! Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections.

  •        CS 88 – CLASS IS CLOSED until further notice. At this time no instructor has been found for the class so we cannot open it for enrollment. The intention is to teach the class in F19 however. 

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1.      To see who can enroll into CS lower div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower


  2.      Time Conflicts – Unless noted, the enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3.      Waitlist Processing:
  •        We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.
  •        During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.
  •        If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.
  •        Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1.      999 sections will be used for lower division classes for EXCEPT CS C8 and CS 10. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

        Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  •        During first lecture
  •        Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)
  •        Via course home page
